docs.text: Welcome Welcome to My Research summary website. Here the important summary of research paper will be compiled. There will be three catagories. Electronic , Thermal and Photonics . Another section will be dedicated for Language learning.

docs.text: This is a page for the software i install in my ubuntu 18.04 . I have already installed softwares like LAMMPS, vmd, Comsol, Ovito etc for my undergraduate thesis. Installation of Quantum Espresso The following pages helped me install quantum espresso. How to install Quantum Espresso in Ubuntu Linux Installing Quantum ESPRESSO (serial) on Linux-UBUNTU Making a customized GUI Ins

docs.text: Thermal Properties Characterization of thermal and mechanical properties of stanene nanoribbons: a molecular dynamics study Author : Asir, Ratul, Samia Material : Stanene - buckled honeycomb structure of Tin Details of Structure : Size-Nanoribbon; 10 nm × 3 nm zigzag and armchair height (0.88 Å) Process : EMD DFT Tools/Softwares : LAMMPS Quantum Espresso Variable Characteristics : Temperature, Width, Defect - point vacancy, edge vacancy and bi-vacancy Stress - strain Potentials : MEAM Result : TC --> 0.95 ± 0.024 W m−1 K−1 and 0.89 ± 0.026 W m−1 K−1 electron effective mass for pristine and defected stanene are ∼0.49 × 106 ms−1 and ∼0.2 × 106 ms−1 Key Foundings : TC decrease with Temperature increase TC increase with Width increase Applicability in Thermoelectrics: small electron effective mass and high fermi velocity 2 Thermal transport characterization of stanene/silicene heterobilayer and stanene bilayer nanostructures Author : Maliha Noshin, Asir Intisar Khan and Samia Subrina Material : Stanene/Silicene- heterobilayer Stanene bilayer Details of Structure : Nanoribbon; 10 nm × 3 nm Height (0.88 Å) Lattice constant: stanene: 4.72 Å silicene: 3.8Å Bond length: Sn-Sn : 2.84Å Si-Si : 2.24Å Buckling Height Si : 0.43Å Sn : 0.83 Å Interlayer distance: 3.4 Å Supercell composition of 5x5 lateral periodicity of silicene and 4x4 lateral periodicity of stanene. Process : EMD PDOS Tools/Softwares : LAMMPS Phana Variable Characteristics : Temperature, Width, Potentials : Sn-Sn: Optimized Tersoff ; Parameters: Si-Si: Stillinger-Weber (SW) For Heterobilayer: LJ- Ɛ(𝑆𝑛−𝑆𝑖) = 20.703 𝑚𝑒𝑉, 𝜎(𝑆𝑛−𝑆𝑖) = 4.1 Å and 𝑟𝑐 = 3.5 𝜎(𝑆𝑛−𝑆𝑖) - Simulation Parameters : - Volume: In the case of the silicene/stanene heterobilayer, the van der Waals thickness of the bilayer is taken to be 8.7 Å, which is the summation of the thickness of silicene layer28(4.2 Å) and stanene monolayer (4.5 Å including its buckling height) . On the other hand, for stanene bilayer, the van der Waals thickness is taken to be 9 Å. Thickness Choice Ref1 ,Ref2 , Ref3 - Periodic Boundary: Zigzag direction - Ts : 0.5 fs - 3 x 10^5 Timesteps - Nose-Hoover thermostat - 10^5 Timesteps - NVE ensemble - Stepest decent algorithm Result : TC --> stanene/silicene heterobilayer nanoribbon at room temperature (300 K) is 3.63± 0.27 W/m-K and 1.31 ± 0.34 W/m-K for stanene bilayer Key Foundings : TC decrease with Temperature increase TC increase with Width increase Applicability in Thermoelectrics: small electron effective mass and high fermi velocity
docs.title: Thermal Properties

docs.text: Author : Asir, Ratul, Samia Material : Stanene - buckled honeycomb structure of Tin Details of Structure : Size-Nanoribbon; 10 nm × 3 nm zigzag and armchair height (0.88 Å) Process : EMD DFT Tools/Softwares : LAMMPS Quantum Espresso Variable Characteristics : Temperature, Width, Defect - point vacancy, edge vacancy and bi-vacancy Stress - strain Potentials : MEAM Result : TC --> 0.95 ± 0.024 W m−1 K−1 and 0.89 ± 0.026 W m−1 K−1 electron effective mass for pristine and defected stanene are ∼0.49 × 106 ms−1 and ∼0.2 × 106 ms−1 Key Foundings : TC decrease with Temperature increase TC increase with Width increase Applicability in Thermoelectrics: small electron effective mass and high fermi velocity 2
docs.title: Characterization of thermal and mechanical properties of stanene nanoribbons: a molecular dynamics study

docs.text: Author : Maliha Noshin, Asir Intisar Khan and Samia Subrina Material : Stanene/Silicene- heterobilayer Stanene bilayer Details of Structure : Nanoribbon; 10 nm × 3 nm Height (0.88 Å) Lattice constant: stanene: 4.72 Å silicene: 3.8Å Bond length: Sn-Sn : 2.84Å Si-Si : 2.24Å Buckling Height Si : 0.43Å Sn : 0.83 Å Interlayer distance: 3.4 Å Supercell composition of 5x5 lateral periodicity of silicene and 4x4 lateral periodicity of stanene. Process : EMD PDOS Tools/Softwares : LAMMPS Phana Variable Characteristics : Temperature, Width, Potentials : Sn-Sn: Optimized Tersoff ; Parameters: Si-Si: Stillinger-Weber (SW) For Heterobilayer: LJ- Ɛ(𝑆𝑛−𝑆𝑖) = 20.703 𝑚𝑒𝑉, 𝜎(𝑆𝑛−𝑆𝑖) = 4.1 Å and 𝑟𝑐 = 3.5 𝜎(𝑆𝑛−𝑆𝑖) - Simulation Parameters : - Volume: In the case of the silicene/stanene heterobilayer, the van der Waals thickness of the bilayer is taken to be 8.7 Å, which is the summation of the thickness of silicene layer28(4.2 Å) and stanene monolayer (4.5 Å including its buckling height) . On the other hand, for stanene bilayer, the van der Waals thickness is taken to be 9 Å. Thickness Choice Ref1 ,Ref2 , Ref3 - Periodic Boundary: Zigzag direction - Ts : 0.5 fs - 3 x 10^5 Timesteps - Nose-Hoover thermostat - 10^5 Timesteps - NVE ensemble - Stepest decent algorithm Result : TC --> stanene/silicene heterobilayer nanoribbon at room temperature (300 K) is 3.63± 0.27 W/m-K and 1.31 ± 0.34 W/m-K for stanene bilayer Key Foundings : TC decrease with Temperature increase TC increase with Width increase Applicability in Thermoelectrics: small electron effective mass and high fermi velocity
docs.title: Thermal transport characterization of stanene/silicene heterobilayer and stanene bilayer nanostructures
